intro: Comparettia palatina, commonly known as the Palatine bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for shaded garden landscapes.
